title: Do mothers & newborns run a higher risk of dying in Nairobi, as governor Sonko said?
subtitle: Kenya’s freshly elected representatives are full of plans and promises. Nairobi governor Mike Sonko pledged to improve health standards, saying mothers and newborns have a higher chance of dying in childbirth in his county than a far flung rural one.
author: africacheck.org

Could one of Kenya’s more remote regions have better survival rates than its main city, a regional hub and magnet for multinationals? We checked.

What counts as a maternal or newborn death 



 Maternal mortality is the death of a woman during pregnancy, childbirth or 42 days after birth or the termination of a pregnancy. This does not include accidental causes. 



 The risk of death associated with each pregnancy expressed in the number of maternal deaths per 100,000 of the female population of reproductive age (15-49). 



 The probability of a 15-year-old woman of eventually dying from a pregnancy or childbirth related cause in her lifetime. 



 : Newborn, or neonatal, mortality is the death of a child in the first 28 days of life.
